dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSEUPS OF FLICKERING INSTRUMENT PANELS.  Readou displays pulse eerily with the technology of the distant Wherever we are, it seems to be chill, dark, and sterile. machinery chuckles softly to itself. Abruptly we hear a BEEPING SIGNAL, and the machinery begi Circuits close, lights blink on. CAMERA ANGLES GRADUALLY WIDEN, revealing more and more of machinery, banks of panels, fluttering gauges, until we r

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: A stainless steel room with no windows, the walls packed instrumentation.  The lights are dim and the air is frigi Occupying most of the floor space are rows of horizontal COMPARTMENTS, looking for all the world like meat lockers FOOM!  FOOM!  FOOM!  With explosions of escaping gas, the freezers pop open. Slowly, groggily, six nude men sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... God... am I cold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you, Roby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's you all right. Now they are yawning, stretching, and shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh... I must be alive, I feel dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampires rise from their graves. This draws a few woozy chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his fist in the air triumphantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not fully awake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yawning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, that's terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around with a grin)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how does it feel to be rich men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold! This draws a LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Everybody topside!  Let's get our pants on and get to our posts! The men begin to swing out of the freezers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody get the cat. Roby picks a limp cat out of a freezer.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: This is a fantastic circular room, jammed with instrument are no windows, but above head level the room is ringed b viewscreens, all blank for the moment. There are seats for four men.  Each chair faces a console surrounded by a dazzling array of technology. STANDARD, ROBY, BROUSSARD, and MELKONIS are entering and seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to buy a cattle ranch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (putting down the cat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cattle ranch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding.  You can get one if you have the credit.  Look just like real cows, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, tycoons, let's stop spending our credit and start worrying about the job at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Fire up all systems. They begin to throw switches, lighting up their consoles. room starts to come to life.  All around the room, colore flicker and chase each other across glowing screens.  The with the hum and chatter of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy, you want to give us some vision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feast your eyes. Melkonis reaches to his console and presses a bank of swi strip of viewscreens flickers into life. On each screen, we see BLACKNESS SPECKLED WITH STARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Irth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy, scan the whole sky. Melkonis hits buttons.  On the screens the images all beg CAMERA MOVES IN ON ONE OF THE SCREENS, with its moving im starfield.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT OF A PANNING TV CAMERA.  This camera is remote turning silently on its base. CAMERA BEGINS TO PULL BACK, revealing that the TV camera the HULL OF SOME KIND OF CRAFT. When the pullback is finished, WE SEE THE FULL LENGTH OF "SNARK," hanging in the depths of interstellar space, aga background of glimmering stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy, contact traffic control. Melkonis switches on his radio unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is deep space commercial vessel SNARK, registration number E180246, calling Antarctica air traffic control.  Do you read me?  Over. There is only the HISS OF STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at a screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't recognize that constellation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell, plot our location. Broussard goes into action, punching buttons, lighting up instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it.  Oh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just short of Zeta II Reticuli.  We haven't even reached the outer rim yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Standard picks up a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Chaz speaking.  Sorry, but we are not home.  Our present location seems to be only halfway to Irth. Remain at your posts and stand by. That is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz, I've got something here on my security alert.  A high priority from the computer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punches buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, you have signalled a priority three message.  What is the message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a mechanical voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have interrupted the course of the voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am programmed to do so if certain conditions arise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, this is Captain Standard. What conditions are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have intercepted a transmission of unknown origin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A transmission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A voice transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out here? The men exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have recorded the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it for us, please. Over the speakers, we hear a hum, a crackle, static... TH

dialogues.speaker: STRANGE, UNEARTHLY VOICE FILLS THE ROOM, SPEAKING AN ALIE
dialogues.text: LANGUAGE.  The bizarre voice speaks a long sentence, then silent. The men all stare at each other in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, what language was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown!  What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is none of the 678 dialects spoken by technological man. There is a pause, then EVERYBODY STARTS TALKING AT THE SA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (silencing them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold it, hold it! (glares around the room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer: have you attempted to analyze the transmission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  There are two points of salient interest.  Number one: it is highly systematized, indicating intelligent origin.  Number two: certain sounds are inconsistent with the human palate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's finally happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First contact...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy, can you home in on that beam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the frequency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer, what's the frequency of the transmission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65330 dash 99. Melkonis punches buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got it.  It's coming from ascension 6 minutes 32 seconds, declination -39 degrees 2 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell -- show me that on a screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give it to you on number four. Broussard punches buttons.  One of the viewscreens flicke small dot of light becomes visible in the corner of the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.  Let me straighten it out. He twists a knob, moving the image on the screen till the the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get it a little closer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm going to do. He hits a button.  The screen flashes and a PLANET APPEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Planetoid.  Diameter, 120 kilometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tiny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any rotation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Point eight six.  We can walk on it. Standard rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, get the others up to the lounge.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The entire crew -- STANDARD, ROBY, BROUSSARD, MELKONIS, H FAUST -- are all seated around a table, with Standard at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's an S.O.S., we're morally obligated to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Seems to me we came on this trip to make some credit, not to go off on some kind of side trip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the credit; what we have here is a chance to be the first men to contact a nonhuman intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is some kind of alien intelligence down on that planetoid, it'd be a serious mistake for us to blunder in unequipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, we're equipped --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, no!  We don't know what's down there on that piece of rock!  It might be dangerous!  What we should do is get on the radio to the exploration authorities... and let them deal with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except it will take 75 years to get a reply back.  Don't forget how far we are from the Colonies, Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no commercial lanes out here.  Face it, we're out of range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men have waited centuries to contact another form of intelligent life in the universe.  This is an opportunity which may never come again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're overruled, Martin.  Gentlemen -- let's go.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The men are strapping in, but this time it is with grim d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell, I want greater magnification. More surface detail.  I want to see what this place looks like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see what I can do. He jabs his controls.  The image on the screen ZOOMS DOWN PLANET; but all detail quickly vanishes into a featureles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's out of focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- that's atmosphere.  Cloud layer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, it's stormy for a piece of rock that size!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a second. (punches buttons)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those aren't water vapor clouds; they have no moisture content.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put ship in atmospheric mode.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The great dish antenna on the SNARK folds down against th of the ship, and other parts flatten out, until the ship an aerodynamic form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell, set a course and bring us in on that beam.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK's engines cough into life, and send it drifting distant dot that is the planetoid. CAMERA APPROACHES THE PLANETOID, until it looms large on turbulent, completely enveloped in dun-colored clouds. The SNARK drops down toward the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activate lifter quads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Activated.  Vertical drop checked. Correcting course.  On tangential course now, orbiting. (brief pause as he studies his instruments)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossing the terminator.  Entering night side.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Beneath the orbiting SNARK, night's curtain rolls across Descending at an angle, the SNARK drops down into the thi of the planetoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atmospheric turbulence.  Dust storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn on navigation lights.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hydroplaning down through the pea-soup atmosphere, a set lights switches on, cutting through the dust, but hardly visibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching point of origin.  Closing at 20 kilometers, 15 and slowing. Ten.  Five.  Gentlemen, we are directly above the source of the transmission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the terrain down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, line of sight is impossible due to dust.  Radar gives me noise. Sonar gives me noise.  Infrared -- noise.  Let's try ultraviolet.  There. Flat.  It's totally flat.  A plain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it solid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... basalt.  Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then take her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop begins... now!  Fifteen kilometers and dropping... twelve...  ten... eight and slowing.  Five. Three.  Two.  One kilometer and slowing.  Lock tractor beams. There is a LOUD ELECTRICAL HUM and the ship shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill drive engines. The engines fall silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engines off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine hundred meters and dropping. 800.  700.  Hang on gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The night-shrouded surface is a hell of blowing dust.  Th above it on glowing beams of light, dropping down slowly. Landing struts unfold like insect legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're... down.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The ship touches down, heavily; it rocks on huge shock ab

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The whole ship VIBRATES VIOLENTLY FOR AN INSTANT -- then panels in the room flash simultaneously and the LIGHT'S G

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! The lights come back on again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits a switch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine room, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, hold it, I'm checking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has the hull been breached?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...  (scans his gauges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't see anything.  We've still got pressure. There is a BEEP from the communicator.  Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, this is Jay.  The intakes are clogged with dust.  We overheated and burned out a whole cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strikes his panel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!  How long to fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long to fix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, get started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take a look outside.  Turn the screens back on. Melkonis hits buttons.  The screens flicker, but remain b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see a blessed thing.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Only a few glittering lights distinguish the ship from th darkness around it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kick on the floods.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: A ring of FLOODLIGHTS on the ship come to life, pouring b out into the night. They illuminate nothing but a patch of featureless grey g clouds of blowing dust.  The wind shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much help. Standard stares at the dark screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can't go anywhere in this darkness.  How long till dawn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (consults his instruments)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... this rock rotates every two hours.  The sun should be coming up in about 20 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  Maybe we'll be able to see something then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or something will be able to see us. They all look at him.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The floodlights on the SNARK fight a losing battle agains darkness and the storm.  MAIN THEME MUSIC BEGINS, EXTREME

dialogues.speaker: RUN TITLES.
dialogues.text: Gradually, the screen begins to lighten as the SUN RISES. silhouette of the SNARK becomes visible, like some strang crouching motionless on the barren plain.  The floods shu clouds of impenetrable dust shriek and moan, obscuring ev reducing the sunlight to a dull orange. END MAIN TITLES.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SCREEN - it shows nothing but swirling clouds dust. PULL BACK FROM SCREEN.  The men (Standard, Roby, Broussar Melkonis) are sitting and standing around the room, drink and staring at the screens, which reveal only the billowi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There could be a whole city out there and we'd never see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sitting on our butts in here, that's for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just settle down.  Sandy, you get any response yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls off his earphones)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.  Nothing but that same damn transmission, every 32 seconds.  I've tried every frequency on the spectrum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we just going to sit around and wait for an invitation? Roby gives Broussard a black look, then stabs a button on and speaks into the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Faust!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it coming on the engines?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust is seated at an electronic workbench, brightly lit, into a wall intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw anything as fine as this dust... these cells are all pitted on a microscopic level.  I have to polish these things smooth again, so it's going to take a while.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. (puts down the mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandy... how far are we from the source of the transmission?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Source of transmission is to the northeast... about 300 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough to walk to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, would you run me an atmospheric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (punches buttons and consults his panels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10% argon, 85% nitrogen, 5% neon...  and some trace elements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nontoxic... but unbreathable. Pressure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten to the fourth dynes per square centimeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  Moisture content?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zero.  Dry as a bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any microorganisms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a one.  It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, rock particles.  Dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we won't need pressure suits, but breathing masks are called for. Sandy -- can you rig up some kind of portable unit that we can use to follow that transmission to its source?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I volunteer for the exploration party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you.  You want to break out the side arms?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Broussard and Melkonis enter the lock.  They al boots, jackets, and pistols. Broussard touches a button and the inner door slides sile sealing them into the lock. They all pull on rubber full-head oxygen masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adjusting the radio on his mask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sending.  Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Receiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Receiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.  Now just remember: keep away from those weapons unless I say otherwise.  Martin, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read you, Chaz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the outer door. Ponderously, the outer lock door slides open.  ORANGE SUN into the lock, and clouds of dust swirl in.  We hear the WIND OUTSIDE. A mobile stairway slides out of the open hatchway, and cl hits the ground. Standard walks out into the storm, followed by the others

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three men trot down the gangplank to the surface of t Their feet sink into a thick layer of dust and loose rock The men huddle together, looking around.  The wind scream their clothes.  Nothing can be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way, Sandy? Melkonis is fiddling with a portable direction-finder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lead. Melkonis walks into the blinding dust clouds, followed cl others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Martin.  We're on our way.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is the sole occupant of the bridge.  He is huddled o console, smoking a cigarette and watching three moving bl screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Chaz, I hear you.  I've got you on my board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I'm getting you clear too. Let's just keep the line open.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three men plough their way through a limbo of yellow shrieking wind.  With their rubbery masks and deliberate they look like deep-sea divers at the bottom of a murky o Melkonis leads the column, following the compass on the d finder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't see more than three meters in any direction out here.  We're walking blind, on instruments. They wade on, following Melkonis.  Abruptly he halts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My signal's fading. He studies the direction finder.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is listening intently to the dialogue from the helme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the dust, it's interfering...  His concentration is so great that he does NOT NOTICE HUN BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Hold it, I've got it again.  It's over that way. Standing DIRECTLY BEHIND ROBY, Hunter speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? Startled out of his wits, Roby GASPS and whirls around to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled silly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell! Hunter stares at Roby, whose momentary terror dissolves i embarrassed anger.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three men push their way through the storm.  Melkonis studies the direction finder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's close, real close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be almost on top of it.  I just can't quite...  Suddenly, Broussard grabs Standard's arm and points.  The in the direction he is pointing.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POINT-OF-VIEW
dialogues.text: Through the dense clouds of swirling dust we can just bar some kind of HUGE SHAPE. As we watch, the dust clears slightly, REVEALING A GROTES RISING FROM THE SHIP LIKE SOME GIGANTIC TOADSTOOL.  It is non-human manufacture.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEN
dialogues.text: They are struck dumb by the sight of the craft.  Finally, finds his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, uh, we've found it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply -- over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be some sort of spacecraft.  We're going to approach it. They start toward the alien ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no signs of life.  No lights... no movement...  Roby and Hunter are listening with hypnotic concentration

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're, uh, approaching the base.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: A strangely shaped DOOR yawns open at the base of the shi sand have blown in, filling the lower part of the entranc With great caution, the men approach the entrance and gro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears to be a door hanging open, the entrance is clogged with debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a derelict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, we're going in.  I'm going to hold the conversation to a minimum from here on.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The doorway is a glowing geometric blur of light against spewing dust.  In the darkness of the chamber are huge, f shapes. Standard, Broussard and Melkonis appear silhouetted again doorway.  They switch on flashlight-like devices called " and step in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, peering around, they pick their way past the i machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air lock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try and find the control room. As they move their lights around, they can see that the w ceiling, and machinery are FULL OF HUGE, IRREGULAR HOLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these holes.  This place looks like Swiss cheese. Broussard shines his light up into a huge hole in the cei

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This hole goes up several decks -- looks like somebody was firing a military disintegrator in here. They all peer up the hole into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climbing gear. Standard draws out a stubby spear gun with a graplon atta He aims it up into the hole and fires. The graplon is launched up into darkness, trailing a thin is a dull CLUNK, and the wire dangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you'll follow me. Standard attaches the wire to a powered gear box on his c presses a button.  With a mechanical whine, he is pulled hole, using his feet for leverage where he can. Broussard attaches the wire to his own chest unit.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: This chamber is totally dark as Broussard arrives at the hole. Standard stands with his flashlight/camera ("datastick") beam through the hanging dust. Broussard unclips himself from the climbing wire, then ra light.  At that moment, Melkonis arrives at the top of th THEIR LIGHTS SCAN THE ROOM.  The beams are clearly visibl of light in the floating dust.  They reveal heavy, odd sh Broussard stumbles over something.  He shines his light d It is a large, glossy urn, brown in color, with peculiar Broussard stands it upright.  It has a round opening in t empty. Suddenly, Melkonis lets out a grunt of shock.  Their ligh illuminated something unspeakably grotesque: A HUGE ALIEN SEATED IN THE CONTROL CHAIR. They approach the skeleton, their lights trained on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ...  Standard shines his light on the console at which the hid is seated.  He moves his light closer and peers at the pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this...  They approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something has been scratched here...  into the veneer.  See? Traced raggedly onto the surface of the panel, as by the sharp instrument, is a small triangle:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing something, Broussard flashes his light across the beam scans the walls, it briefly touches on SOMETHING THA Melkonis convulsively yanks out his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: LOOK OUT, IT MOVED
dialogues.text: Standard knocks his hand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep away from that gun! Standard shoulders himself in front of the others.  Then, begins to move toward the far side of the room. They approach a console on the wall, training their light There is a machine.  On the machine, a small bar moves st and forth, sliding noiselessly in its grooves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But functioning. Melkonis looks down at his direction finder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where the transmission is coming from. He throws a switch on the direction finder -- with a crac hum, the UNEARTHLY VOICE fills their earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A recording.  A damned automatic recording.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: SINISTER ANGLE ON THE SNARK.  As we watch, the sunlight t of blood, and then the sun is down, leaving murky blackne wake.  The ring of floodlights on the ship flares into li combatting the darkness and the storm.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The entire crew is seated around the conference table, wa holographic pictures projected onto a screen.  These are by their "datasticks" (flashlight/cameras). Standard is commenting on the changing slides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This is the control room...  Two or three pictures click onto the screen in succession suited men standing against banks of machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Some details of the control room...  The SKELETON appears on the screen.  The men react with m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This is the skeleton... another view of the skeleton... the transmitting device...  The triangle that was cut into the alien's console appear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... This is a closeup of the triangle we found scrawled on the console in front of the skeleton...  Standard changes the slide.  The screen goes white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And that's it. He turns off the projector and brings the lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phenomenal.  Staggering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to go back and take a lot more pictures, holograph everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And bring back as much physical evidence as possible, too.  The rest of the skeleton.  Some of the machinery.  Written records, if there are any. Roby is slumped in his chair.  He has said nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.  This is the single most important discovery in history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What killed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, that thing's been dead for years.  Maybe hundreds of years.  The whole planet's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way I figure it, they landed here for repairs or something, then they couldn't take off again.  Maybe the dust ruined their engines.  They set up an S.O.S. beacon, but nobody came.  So they died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not they... he...  They all turn to look in the direction of Roby's nod.  CA OVER TO REVEAL THE ALIEN SKULL SITTING ON A TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... There was only one skeleton. There is a moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay... how's it coming on the repairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I'm going to have to blow the engines out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when will you be ready to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- I'm not near ready yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why the hell are you sitting around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. The men rise and begin to disperse, but Roby remains seat thought, staring at the skull.  Melkonis lingers in the r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there sits man's first contact with intelligent life in the universe.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE SHIP, its spotlights cutting into the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: A room throbbing with power, enormous pulsing engines cap releasing unimaginable energies. Faust has a complicated arrangement set up at the base of engines, with spotlights on it.  He is wearing goggles an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready up there?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard and Melkonis are seated at their consoles, conv Faust while they watch their instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, we're ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  I'm going to start the extraction procedure now. He pauses to wipe his brow.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is alone in the room, slumped into a chair, watching photographic slides on the screen.  He is clicking slowly He stops on an angle of the skeleton, and stares at it. The alien's misshapen skull is sitting on the table next picks it up, holds it up to the screen for comparison, an Standard appears in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alas, poor Yorick. Roby STARTS, puts down the skull.  Standard sits at the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding at the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find anything we missed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know what I'm looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh well... you know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always respected your opinion, Martin.  If something worries you, it worries me. Roby reaches over and changes the slide, to the one of th DRAWN TRIANGLE ON THE ALIEN CONTROL PANEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say that was supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's obviously intentional...  some kind of attempt at communication... maybe it's a symbol that means something to them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why draw it on the wall? Roby switches off the projector, sits up, and rubs his fa He rises and goes to the coffee machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking a hair out of the coffeepot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ship is full of cat hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, Martin.  As soon as the engine's fixed -- BEEP!  The communicator interrupts Standard.  He leans ac presses the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Chaz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz, this is Dell.  Can you come topside for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the sun just came up again, and it seems the wind's died down. It's as clear as a bell outside. There's something I think you ought to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way. He and Roby head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard is alone in the control room when Standard and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The dust no longer blows.  The day is crisp, clear, and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was scanning the horizon to see what I could pick up.  Look there, on that screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, I can't -- BLIP!  Broussard enlarges the image. The screen now shows a TAPERING STONE PYRAMID on the hori They all stare at the image for a long moment.  The silho

dialogues.speaker: PYRAMID IS INSTANTLY SUGGESTIVE OF THE SCRAWLED TRIANGLE
dialogues.text: ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standard presses the nearest communicator and speaks into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Chaz.  All hands topside. Now.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A VIEWSCREEN.  It shows the PYRAMID on the horiz PULLS BACK to reveal all the men, sitting and standing ar room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't seem much doubt about it, does there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That creature sure must have considered it important... using his last strength to draw it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they built it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A marker for buried instrumentation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a mass grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the rest of the crew is in there -- in some kind of suspended animation, waiting to be rescued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't necessarily built by them. On the screens, a puff of DUST blows in front of the pyra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the dust again.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: WITH A SHRIEK, THE DUST STORM RETURNS, completely obscuri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, does anyone else agree with Martin that we should not explore it? Everyone looks around the room, but no one volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the sooner we get moving, the better.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT OF THE STONE PYRAMID, dust blowing in front of crumbling, ancient edifice, made of eroded grey stones, w tapering toward the top. Standard, Broussard, and Melkonis, wearing the protective approach the pyramid.  As they draw near, it becomes clea pyramid is roughly 50 feet tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't make out any details or features yet... but it's definitely too regular for a natural formation...

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby and Hunter are present.  They are listening to Stand THE RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... There's one thing I can say for sure though...  BUZZZZZ!  Standard's voice is DROWNED OUT BY STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've completely lost their signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get them back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three men come to the base of the massive structure. have piled thickly around the crumbling, grey stones that base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This looks ancient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell -- these weather conditions could erode anything, fast. They walk around the base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the entrance is buried.  Could be under our feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe there is no entrance; the thing may be solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there ought to be some way we can get through to them -- The INTERCOM BEEPS.  Faust's voice is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to interrupt, but I'm gonna charge up the engines for a minute, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.  Go ahead. A LOUD, POWERFUL THROBBING BEGINS, drowning out all other the engines are tested. A light on Roby's panel is FLASHING.  We can see that it COMPUTER ALERT. Irritably, Roby throws the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a temporary sequence on the monitor --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, I can't hear a damn thing! He puts an earphone to his ear and switches the computer'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead! There is a PAUSE while Roby listens to the computer.  His

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... you've translated it? Another PAUSE as he listens to the earphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well come on, come on!  What does it say? Another PAUSE.  Roby's face changes; he looks CHILLED TO mouth works. Abruptly, THE ENGINES SHUT OFF, LEAVING A RINGING SILENCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking over at Roby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer just translated the goddamn message.  It's not an S.O.S. It was a warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can get in by the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Broussard takes out the graplon-gun, and fires the hook u top of the pyramid.  It catches.  He clips himself to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys just wait down here till I say it's okay to come up. Broussard turns on the climbing device, and begins to wal of the pyramid. OMINOUS ANGLES showing Broussard climbing the pyramid, th blowing, the wind shrieking.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The peak of the pyramid is in extreme disrepair.  Broussa the top and clings to the jagged, crumbling stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a hole at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's too small, only room enough for one person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see anything in the hole?

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard leans over and looks into the hole.  He sees on Freeing one arm, he unclips his datastick from his belt, the "flashlight" function, and shines it down into the ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see... partway down.  It just goes down like a stovepipe.  Smooth walls.  I can't see the bottom -- light won't reach.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust comes trotting up the steps, a questioning look on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay, we've got a problem.  I was wondering if there was any way you could shortcut the repairs and give us immediate takeoff capability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer's translated the alien signal, and it's kind of alarming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't translate the whole thing, only three phrases.  I'll just read it to you the way I got it: (reads from a strip of paper)

dialogues.speaker: NOT LAND... "
dialogues.text: (looks up at the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all it could translate.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hanging from the lip of the hole, Broussard is unclipping his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell, you want to come down, we can figure out where to go from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to go in.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Melkonis exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Dell, but just for a preliminary look-around.  Don't unhook yourself from your cable.  And be out in less than ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Broussard has rigged a tripod across the mouth of the hol unspools a couple feet of wire from the device, and attac of it to his chest unit. He climbs over the lip and drops into the hole.  He is no the wire, with his head and shoulders out of the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm in the mouth of the chimney now, and I'm starting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care. Broussard activates the climbing unit and lowers himself hole.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Bracing his feet against the rough stone wall of the vert Broussard switches on his datastick and points it down in depths. The beam penetrates only thirty feet or so, then is lost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's noticeably warmer in here.  Warm air rising from below. He starts down, paying out the line and moving down in sh pushing off each time with his feet. He stops to catch his breath.  His breathing rasps loudly helmet. A little sunlight filters down from above.  Looking up, h mouth of the hole, a glowing spot of light. Standard's voice comes over his earphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping for breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm okay.  Haven't hit bottom yet.  Definitely a column of warm air rising; it keeps the shaft clear of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that Dell, I lost you, do you read me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this is hard work.  Can't talk now. He kicks off and continues down, taking longer and longer gains confidence. Pausing for a moment to regain his breath, he shines the instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm way below ground level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't make it out -- too much interference.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby and Hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting nowhere.  The whole area around the pyramid is dead to transmission.  I think we should go after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they don't know about the translation!  They could be in danger right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't spare the personnel.  We've got minimum takeoff capability right now.  That's why Chaz left us on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, you chickenshit bastard --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just can that crap!  I'm in command here till Chaz returns!  And nobody's leaving this ship!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard resumes his downward climb.  SUDDENLY, HIS FEET PURCHASE AS THE WALLS OF THE SHAFT DISAPPEAR. The tunnel has reached its end.  Below him is an unfathom cavernous space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huffing and puffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tunnel's gone -- cave or something below me -- feels like the tropics in here; air is warm and humid...  (consults his instruments)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... high oxygen content, no dust, it's completely breathable -- Puffing with exertion, he releases his purchase on the st begins to lower himself on power.  Now he is dangling fre spinning slowly on the wire as the chest unit unwinds. Finally, his feet hit bottom.  He grunts in surprise and his balance.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard is standing on a dusty stone floor, with a feeb sunlight shining down around him from the tunnel above. solid darkness. He flashes his datastick around.  The beam reveals that h stone room.  STRANGE HEIROGLYPHICS are carved into the wa a primitive, religious appearance.  Row after row of pict from floor to ceiling, some epic history in an unknown la religious symbols dominate one wall. Spaced at intervals are stylized stone statues, depicting monsters, half anthropoid, half octopus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unbelievable!  It's like some kind of tomb... some primitive religion!  Hey, is anybody there?  Do you read me?  Standard! Annoyed, Broussard yanks off his breathing goggles, and l hanging around his neck.  He takes a deep breath of the w

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Melkonis are standing around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't hear from him soon, I think we better go in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun will be down in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Face bare, Broussard approaches the center of the room, w dominated by a large, broad pedestal.  On the pedestal ar

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALIEN SHIP
dialogues.text: He walks around the urns, studying them.  They all have s shines his light on one of them; then he lays his gloved He lifts his mask radio to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if you can hear me, but the place is full of large bottles or jars, just like the one we found on the other ship -- except these are all sealed.  Also they're soft to the touch. He peers more closely at the leathery object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another funny thing -- I just put my hand on it, and now there are these raised areas appearing where my fingertips were.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: THE SUN DROPS BELOW THE HORIZON, throwing the landscape i Standard and Melkonis switch on their lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. He attaches his chest unit to the wire and starts up.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Broussard is moving his light along the rows of heiroglyp wall.  They depict stylized drawings of strange monsters. He pauses to quickly change the film clip in his datastic turns back to the "urn" he was examining -- BUT NOW THERE THE TOP OF IT. He shines his light on the floor at the base of the "urn. the "lid" -- the stopper that had filled the hole.  He pi studies it.  It appears more organic than artificial; the surface is spongy and irregular. Then he turns the light to the now-open "urn." He bends over the mouth of the "urn" shining the light in

dialogues.speaker: ITSELF TO HIS FACE, WRAPPING ITS TENTACLES AROUND HIS HEA
dialogues.text: With a MUFFLED SCREAM, he launches himself backward, tear thing with his hands.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The dust blows and howls as Standard and Melkonis arrive lights bobbing in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puffing with exertion)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's his line.  We can haul him out of there if we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll yank him right off his feet if he's not expecting it.  The line could get tangled in something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what can we do?  He's out of radio contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just wait a few more minutes. Standard hesitates, clinging to the lip of the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (making up his mind)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I told him to be out in ten minutes.  It's been much longer. Let's get him out of there. Standard pulls himself up and crouches precariously on th tunnel.  He begins to fiddle with the winch mechanism fro Broussard's line dangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line's slack.  Christ, do you think the idiot unhooked himself? He switches on the winch motor.  With a whine, it begins line in.  After a moment, the line TIGHTENS WITH A JERK - motor slows down, laboring under the added weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There, it caught!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it still coming up, or is it hooked on something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you see anything? Standard shines his light down into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't see far enough.  The line's moving, though. For a moment, the two men hang to the narrow top of the p saving their strength, while the line reels in and the wi Then Standard shines his light back down in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see him!  Here he comes! The winch begins to LABOR HEAVILY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to grab him! Broussard appears at the top of the pit, dangling limply wire.  Standard reaches for him -- then RECOILS SHARPLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!  There's something on his face! Melkonis attempts to come to his aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him, watch it! In their panic and confusion, the men teeter momentarily, regain their balance.  They shine their lights on Broussa He appears to be completely unconscious -- AND THE OCTOPU STILL WRAPPED AROUND HIS FACE, MOTIONLESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, oh God no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me -- I'm going to try to get it off. With his gloved hands, Standard grasps the tentacled mess pull it from Broussard's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't come -- it's stuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell should I know?  Come on, give me a hand, let's get him out of there! The two men grapple with Broussard's limp body, lifting h hole.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby and Hunter are sitting moodily, silent.  There is a while nothing is said, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got 'em!  They're back on my screens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaps to his feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three blips!  They're coming this way! Roby grabs a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can you guys hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we hear you!  We're coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank Christ!  We lost you!  Listen, there's been a new development --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't talk now; Broussard's injured. We'll need some help getting him into the ship. Roby collapses into a chair, suddenly limp with apprehens feared something like this all along, and now it has begu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay, this is Cleave!  Meet me at the main air lock! Hunter dashes from the room. Roby remains where he is, seated at his console.  He is s mind racing.  CAMERA MOVES IN ON HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hunter comes racing down the steps and hurries up to the door. He presses the wall intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, I'm by the inner lock door! I'll wait here for you to let them in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (strangely quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust comes running up, covered with grime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know -- Broussard got hurt somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt!  How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know -- maybe we'll be real lucky and he just broke his neck. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew we shouldn't of come down here.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is seated alone in the room, listening to the transm Standard and Melkonis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, are you there? Roby leans forward and speaks into the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Chaz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming up now, open the outer lock door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz -- what happened to Broussard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some kind of organism, it's attached itself to him.  Let us in. Roby does not reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me, Martin?  Open the outer door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz, if it's an organism, and we let it in, the ship will be infected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't leave him out here, open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz, listen to me -- we've broken every rule of quarantine.  If we bring an organism on board, we won't have a single layer of defense left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, this is an order!  Open the door! Hating it, Roby leans forward and throws the switch.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: A RED LIGHT goes on, on a console on the wall.  The whine servo is heard, followed by a solid metallic CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outer door's open. After a moment, they hear the motor sound again, followed CLUNK.  The outer door has closed again.  The red light g The inner door slides open, and Standard and Melkonis sta carrying the sagging body of Broussard.  A cloud of choki follows them out of the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling off his mask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You men stay clear, there's a parasite on him. Hunter and Faust RECOIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- God -- oh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know but don't touch it. Give us a hand here, let's get him up to the Autodoc. Hunter and Faust move in carefully to help with the limp

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: One of them flicks on the lights as they come shuffling i medical room, carrying Broussard. Revealed is a rather small cubicle whose walls are lined machinery.  The principle item of interest is a mechanize which rests in a cradle and slides in and out of a slot i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me, come on, let's get him up here. They slide the man onto the bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing, God almighty, didn't you try to get it off him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't come. Standard yanks off his gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Medical gloves. They pull thin elastic gloves from a dispenser in the wal them on. Gingerly, they approach Broussard. Standard places his hands on the octopus-thing that is sl on Broussard's face.  He grasps the tentacles in his hand pull it free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really on there tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me try. Faust takes a pair of pliers from a rack, and carefully g of one of the tentacles.  Squeezing tightly, he leans bac weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Faust's hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, you're tearing his face. A trickle of blood begins to ooze down Broussard's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not coming off -- not without his whole face coming off too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's let the machine work on him. Efficiently, they strip Broussard naked, then Standard pr couple of switches on the wall.  The machine lights up, a is sucked into the slot in the wall. He is visible inside.  The machine immediately sprays a c disinfectant on him, then sterilizes him with a blinding A bank of video monitors pops on, revealing X-ray images parts of his body.  Sensors begin to scan, relays chatter ROBY APPEARS IN THE DOORWAY. Standard turns and looks at him.  For a long moment, the each other, then STANDARD STEPS FORWARD AND SLAPS ROBY AC FACE. The others are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey now, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly puts his hand to his cheek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand why you did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't open the lock; he was going to leave us out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... well, maybe he should have.  I mean, you brought the goddamn thing in here.  Maybe you deserve to get slapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, I've got work to do. Faust exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep my mouth pretty much shut, but I don't like hitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Standard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I had it coming.  Let's call it settled. After a hard stare at Roby, Standard gives him a curt nod his attention to the machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would somebody fill me in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went into the pyramid alone.  We lost radio contact with him.  When we pulled him out, it was on his face. It won't come off, not without injuring him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the only one that knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he breathe? They study the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood's thoroughly oxygenated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how?  His nose and mouth are blocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's look inside his head. Standard punches some buttons, and on the monitors, a kin image in vivid colors appears, depicting Broussard's HEAD TORSO. The parasite is clearly visible on Broussard's face.  In creature is a maze of complicated biology.  But the shock that, in X-ray, we can see that Broussard's jaws are forc and THE PARASITE HAS EXTRUDED SOME KIND OF LONG TUBE, WHI INTO HIS MOUTH AND DOWN HIS THROAT, ending near his stoma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it -- I can't tell anything --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some kind of organ -- it's inserted some kind of tube or something down his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning sick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... God...  Hunter bends over and RETCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's how it's getting oxygen to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense.  It paralyzes him... puts him into a coma... then keeps him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't expect to understand a life form like this.  We're out of our back yard.  Things are different here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can't we kill it?  I mean, we can't leave the damn thing on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know what might happen if we tried to kill it.  At least right now it's keeping him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about cutting it off?  We can't pull it loose, but we can cut off everything but the bottom layer, where it's stuck to his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right... we can't stand here and do nothing. Standard picks up his dusty breathing mask and pulls it o Then he pulls back on his bulky gloves.  Finally, he pres and Broussard slides back out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled in his mask)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody give me a scalpel. Melkonis takes a glittering surgical blade from a slot in and carefully passes it to Standard. Clumsily because of the gloves, Standard manipulates the hand till he has a decent grip on it.  Then he flicks a l with his thumb.  The scalpel begins to hum. Standard advances on the parasite.  The others draw back Roby reaches over and draws yet a longer blade from the r holds it inconspicuously at his side. Standard bends over the parasite.  Carefully, he touches the extreme end of one of the tentacles, where it curves back of Broussard's head. Effortlessly, the electronic blade slides through the ali Immediately, a urine-like fluid begins to flow from the w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've made an incision... it's not reacting... but some kind of yellowish fluid is leaking out of the wound...  The noxious-looking liquid drips down onto the bedding ne Broussard's head.  Instantly, it starts to hiss, and a th smoke curls up from the stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it, this stuff's smoking! The others REACT nervously. By now, the yellow fluid has eaten a hole through the bun dripped down onto the floor below.  The metal floor begin and sizzle, and more smoke rises. The men start to COUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, that smoke's poisonous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's eating a hole in the floor! Abruptly, the men jostle their way out of the room and hu corridor outside, coughing their lungs out. Standard, who is masked, remains.  Frantically, he attemp bandage on the wound, but the fluid instantly melts the b in the process, some of the stuff gets on Standard's glov begin to smoke. Frantically Standard leaps back, pulling off the smoulder Then he runs out into the corridor and yanks off his mask

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stuff's eating right through the metal!  It's going to eat through the decks and right out through the hull! By this time Standard has started to run for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Followed by the others, Standard frantically clangs down the level below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There!  Look! A droplet of the fluid is sizzling on the ceiling.  It oo drips to the floor. It bubbles on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what can we put under it? Standard and Hunter charge down the stairs to the level b

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Hunter move cautiously down the corridor, lo the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  Should be coming through about there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful, don't get under it!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby and Melkonis crouch by the spot on the floor where t sizzles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, that stinks. Roby fishes a pen out of his pocket and probes into the h floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to have stopped penetrating. Hunter comes charging up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's fizzled out. Hunter approaches and looks.  Roby straightens up, starts pen back in his pocket, then changes his mind and stands the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never saw anything like that in my life... except molecular acid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this thing uses it for blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell of a defense mechanism.  You don't dare kill it. Standard comes up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stopped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, thank heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just plain lucky.  That could have gone right through the hull -- taken weeks to patch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reminded me of when I was a kid and the roof leaked -- everybody running for the pots and pans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what about Broussard? They turn and run up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: They all come into the room (Roby carrying the partially Broussard is still motionless on the bunk, with the thing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did it get on him? Standard approaches and peers at Broussard's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank God... just missed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it still dripping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (examining it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to have healed itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes me sick to see him like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there some way we can get it off him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how.  But let's do what we can for him. Standard presses a button, and Broussard slides back into diagnostic coffin.  He presses more buttons, and the disp again, showing different parts of Broussard's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we'd better get some intravenous feeding started.  God knows what that thing is leaching out of him. Standard operates some controls, and the machine begins t Broussard's body, sliding needles into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the screens)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look there, what's that stain on his lungs? The X-ray reveals a spreading dark blot in the vicinity o chest.  In the center, the stain is completely opaque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It appears to be a heavy fluid of some sort... it blocks the X-rays...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That tube must be depositing it in him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be some kind of venom, or poison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  what about the film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What film?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Broussard had film in his datastick, didn't he?  We can see what happened to him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Again we are watching slides in the darkened room.  This Roby, Melkonis, and Hunter are watching the sequence of p taken automatically by Broussard's datastick as he probed The camera reveals the "urns."  The climax of the sequenc comes when THE CREATURE LEAPS OUT OF THE "URN" TOWARD THE and after that the camera drops to a useless angle and pr show a series of meaningless blurs.  Then the reel ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must have been when he got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same thing must've happened to the creatures on the other ship...  except they took one of those jars on board, and opened it there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clicks back through the slides to a picture of one of the "urns")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought they were jars too, or artifacts anyway.  But they're not.  They're eggs, or spore casings.  Let's go back to the heiroglyphics. CLICKETYCLICKETYCLICK -- Melkonis accelerates through the blur, stopping at the one he wants -- which shows a strip heiroglyphs on the wall of the tomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I personally can't make any sense out of it...  CLICK.  CLICK.  Melkonis is changing the slides as they t different angles on the glyphs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crude symbolic language -- looks primitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell -- that kind of stuff could represent printed circuits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds a little fanciful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Primitive pictorial languages are based on common objects in the environment, and this can be used as a starting point for translation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What common objects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, hadn't somebody better check on Broussard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.  The rest of you continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll come with you.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Hunter come down the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's fantastic -- the human race has gone this long without ever encountering another advanced life form, and now we run into a veritable zoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, those things out there aren't the same, you know -- the spaceship and the pyramid.  They're from different cultures and different races.  That ship just landed here -- crashed like we did.  The pyramid and the thing from it are indigenous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could anything be indigenous to this asteroid?  It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it wasn't always dead. They arrive at the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The door slides open, and they step into the room.  Hunte the bed, and it slides out of the wall. THERE IS A LONG, HORRIFIED PAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone. They rush to Broussard's prone form.  THE PARASITE IS GON FACE. Broussard is still unconscious, but he is breathing.  HIS COVERED WITH SUCKER MARKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're in for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door was closed.  It must still be in here. They immediately grow very tense.  Hunter starts edging t door.  Standard grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't open the door.  We don't want it escaping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what the hell good can we do in here?  We can't grab it -- it might jump on us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we can catch it. Standard picks up a stainless steel tray with a lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as we're careful not to damage it...  Tray in one hand, lid in the other, Standard begins movin around the room.  There are very few places to hide. He bends down and peers under the bunk. As he is down on his hands and knees, WE SEE ONE TENTACLE THING, VIBRATING ON A LEDGE JUST ABOVE STANDARD. He rises, and HIS SHOULDER BRUSHES THE TENTACLE.  THE PAR THE FLOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaping back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
