dialogues.text: Shit! But the thing is not moving.  It lies motionless on the f tentacles curled up.  Its color has faded to a dead-looki Without taking his eyes off the thing, Standard reaches b takes a long probe from the wall.  He prods the thing; it respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's dead. With great care, he uses the probe to fish the motionless into the tray.  Then he quickly closes the lid.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Roby, and Melkonis have the parasite spread-eag stainless steel table, with a bright light on it.  It is Wearing gloves, Standard probes at the thing with an inst

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these suckers -- no wonder we couldn't get it off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that its mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More likely that organ -- the tube- like thing -- fits up in there. With a pair of needle-nosed pliers, Standard fishes in th aperture.  Carefully, he extracts the end of the tube-org

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh. Suddenly, it starts to FALL APART IN THE PLIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick -- it's decomposing -- gimme something to grab it with! It begins to SMOKE AND BUBBLE. Roby grabs a long pair of tongs from the wall and thrusts Standard -- who throws down the pliers, snatches the tong the thing in the tongs. It is smouldering and dripping acid on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ!  Let's get it out of here! Carrying the thing, he heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The men run down the passageways, Standard carrying the d in the tongs.  It leaves little smoking droplets on the f

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: They come running up to the airlock.  Roby stabs the butt inner door slides open.  By the time Standard is in the l already on the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Chrissake, open the main lock!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby stumbles in as the inner door closes; and with a hea thick surface door rumbles open.  Orange sunlight billows by the inevitable dust. Standard HURLS THE CARCASS OUT, tongs and all.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The parasite hits the ground and begins to sink into the smouldering and fuming.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The outer door rolls shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slumping against the wall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, it's lethal even when it's dead! Melkonis gets down on his knees and studies the small bur the floor. Standard opens the inner door and steps out into the corr he activates the wall intercom and punches out a combinat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over intercom, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Broussard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running a fever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still unconscious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do anything for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The machine will bring his temperature down.  His vital functions are strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He switches off the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly exhausted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some coffee. He turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The cat is strolling around as Roby and Melkonis drop int Standard draws a cup of coffee from the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These day and night cycles are totally disorienting.  I feel like we've been here for days, but it's only been how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stroking the cat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring into his coffee cup)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to say it looks like you were right in the first place, Martin.  We never should have landed here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not trying to rub anybody's nose in anything.  The important thing is just to get away from here as fast as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't lean on Faust any harder -- he's been working non-stop on the engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we knew exactly what happened to the beings on the other ship --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never made it off the planet. The parasites won. This brings a CHILLY SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did the parasites come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seem native to the planet.  It's got an atmosphere and a dense gravity.  It's dead now, but once it must have been fertile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's just too small to support fauna as big as the parasites.  If there were a native ecology, it would have to be microscopic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't the pyramid have been built here by space travellers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too primitive.  It's a pre- technological construction.  That slab was engineered by an Iron-Age culture at best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from a dead civilization; they're spores from a tomb.  God knows how long they've been here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we better take another look at those heiroglyphs. Suddenly the door opens and Faust sticks his head in.  He with dirt and grime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guess what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The engines are fixed.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK's engines cough and then with a ROAR BEGIN TO B STREAMS OF SUPERHEATED AIR, cutting through the tulgy dus The ship roars and vibrates like a huge beast, capable of power.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: They are all at their posts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch on tractor beams. There is a hair-tingling ELECTRICAL HUM which permeates t ship, and it begins to float, like a cork in water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock tractor beams. The pitch of the hum changes, and the ship levels itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retract landing struts.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The ship is hovering above the ground on beams of shimmer The landing struts fold up under the belly of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up one kilometer, Jay.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK begins to levitate up into the sky, on the beam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Switch on lifter quads. A POWERFUL, DEEP THROBBING BEGINS.  THE SHIP VIBRATES.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The hovering SNARK begins to accelerate through the choki atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engage artificial gravity. Roby throws a switch, and the ship LURCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take her into an escape orbit. The men get busy with switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm altering our vector now; should give us an easy escape velocity -- A HUGE TREMOR RUNS THROUGHOUT THE SHIP. ROBY & MELKONIS (in concert)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? In answer, THE COMMUNICATOR BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This dust is getting clogged in the intakes again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hold us together till we're in space, that's all! The pitch of the engines changes, deepens.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK swoops up at an acute angle into the boiling cl Visibility is zero.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust is pulling on a gasmask, because the engine chamber to fill with dust.  He turns on a huge exhaust unit which suck up some of the dust.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: On the screens, nothing but clouds.  Then, ANOTHER TREMOR THROUGH THE SHIP.  The men no longer speak; their express set, and sweating; they are watching their instruments. they mutter technical instructions to each other.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Abruptly the ship CLEARS THE TOP OF THE CLOUD LAYER AND B INTO STAR-SPRINKLED SPACE, trailing a wake of dust behind

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: They all CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounds his panel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it!  Damn, we made it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet we made it.  Martin, set course for Irth and accelerate us into stardrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great pleasure. Roby begins to punch buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like an escapee from Hell.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The ship's speed is so great that there is perceptible mo universe all around. There is a strange corona effect which causes the stars a the ship to appear blue, and the receding ones to be red. redshift, made visible because of their incredible veloci

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: They are unstrapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the part that always makes me feel like I'm gonna puke -- when we accelerate into light speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit complaining; we're in space. They rise and head out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: As they walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the best thing to do with Broussard is to just freeze him as he is.  It'll arrest the progress of his disease, and he can get complete medical attention when we get back to the Colonies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to go into quarantine, maybe for quite a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, he can remain in hypersleep until they're ready to treat him. They enter the infirmary.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: As they enter the room, THEY ARE SHOCKED TO SEE BROUSSARD in BED -- AWAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hoarsely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Mouth's so dry... can I have some water...  Instantly, Roby brings him a plastic cup of water.  Brous down in a swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More. Roby quickly fills a much bigger container and hands it t who greedily consumes the entire thing.  Then he sags, pa bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel, Dell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wretched.  What happened to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remember nothing.  Can't hardly remember my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in pain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly, just feel like somebody's been beating me with rubber hoses for about six years. Melkonis laughs at this remark.  Broussard smiles faintly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, you're in great shape, you've got your sense of humor back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dell, what's the last thing you can remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember the pyramid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Just some horrible dreams about smothering.  Where are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going home.  We're in hyperspace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going into the freezers now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really starving; can we get some food before we go into the freezers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's a pretty reasonable request.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The entire crew is seated around the table, eating huge p greedily.  The cat eats from a dish on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy do I feel a lot better.  It's a straight shot back to the Colonies, and then we can start taking bids on the paydirt.  Any bets on the top bid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chewing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we should at least be able to each buy our own planet. They all CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to write a book about this expedition.  I'm going to call it "The Snark Log."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The commander normally has first publication rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we could write it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First thing I'm going to do when we get back is eat some biological food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, you don't like this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tastes like something you'd feed a chicken to make it lay more eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's okay.  I've had better cag than this, but I've had worse too, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It grows on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they make this stuff out of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I know what they make it out of, so what?  It's food now.  You're eating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say it was bad for you, it's just kind of sickening, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we have to talk about this kind of crap at the dinner table? Suddenly, unexpectedly, BROUSSARD GRIMACES AND GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice straining)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I'm getting these

dialogues.speaker: CRAMPS
dialogues.text: The others stare at him in alarm.  Another GROAN is torn He clutches the edge of the table with his hands, his knu whitening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathe deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Dell -- what? Broussard's face is screwed up into a mask of agony, and trembling violently from head to foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incoherent shriek)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OhmygooaaAAAHHHHH!!!

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S FIST PUSHES OUT.
dialogues.text: Everybody SCREAMS and leaps back from the table.  The cat bolts. The disgusting little head lunges, comes spurting out of chest trailing a thick, wormlike tail -- splattering flui -- lands in the middle of the dishes and food on the tabl scurries away while the men are stampeding for safe groun When they finally regain control of themselves, it has es Broussard lies slumped in his chair, a huge hole in his c spouting blood.  The dishes are scattered and the food is blood and slime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.  Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  What the Christ was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was growing in him the whole time and he didn't even know it! Slowly, they gather around Broussard's gutted corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That thing used him for an incubator!

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: A hatch slides open on the side of the ship, and Broussar body tumbles silently out. AN ELECTRONIC BASS DRUM BEATS A DIRGE as Broussard drifts eternity.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The entire remaining crew is walking toward the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't go into hypersleep with that thing running around loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be sitting ducks in the freezers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't kill it.  If we kill it, it will spill all its body acids right through our hull and out into space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to catch it and eject it from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I kind of hate to point it out, but all our supplies are based on us spending a strictly limited amount of time out of suspended animation... and as you know, we used up most of that time in harvesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got about a week left, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then we run out of food and oxygen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water will still recycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't need it then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, so that's what we've got. A week.  It's plenty of time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if we haven't caught it in a week, then we have to go into the freezers anyway. They enter the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So does anybody have any suggestions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could put on our pressure suits and blow all the air out of the ship.  That would kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can't afford to lose that much oxygen.  We're going to have to flush it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room by room, corridor by corridor. No one likes this thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do we do when we find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to trap it somehow.  If we had a really strong piece of net, we could bag it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could cut a section out of that metallite netting.  It won't hold up to that acid, but aside from that it's pretty strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to avoid injuring it.  What we really need is some electric animal prods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I could cobble something together.  A long metal rod with a battery in it.  Give it a hell of a shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Get on it.  But first, I'm issuing a standing order: from this moment forth, every one of us will wear protective garments, including helmets.  Let's get down to the locker and change. They start for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK continues on its way through the weird vortex o

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard is walking purposefully along the corridor, alon garmented in an unusual outfit which makes him look like policeman, including clear plastic helmet. He reaches a corner and turns.  But this new passageway h gravity orientation -- Standard seems to be walking down wall. He makes yet another disorienting turn, and now he is wal down.  He reaches a set of steps and climbs up them -- or them.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Melkonis is seated in the dome, upside-down, peering down He also wears the protective suit. Standard, upside-down, climbs into the dome.  It is dark here, under the stars of interstellar space.  A few glowi provide the only illumination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd find you here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking of a line from an old poem: "Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to drink."  All that space out there, and we're trapped in this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the one about the albatross, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't even radio for help; the carrier wave wouldn't reach its destination till long after we'd died and turned to dust.  We are utterly, absolutely alone.  Can anybody really visualize such a scale of distances?  Halfway across Creation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came out there, we'll go back.  A long time by the clock, but a short time to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time and space have no meaning out here.  We're living in Einsteinian equation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see you're putting your spare time to good use. (leans forward and taps him on the knee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you something: you keep staring at hyperspace for long enough, they'll be peeling you off a wall.  I've seen it happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the new pioneers, Chaz.  We even have our own special diseases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- let's go above and see how they're coming with the gear.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The whole crew has assembled.  Faust is unfolding several shimmering metallic netting. Hunter hands out five thin rods, like metal broom handles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These have portable generators in them.  They're insulated down to here -- just be careful not to touch the end. He demonstrates by touching the tip of one of the rods to object.  A blue spark leaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might even incinerate the damn thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it won't damage it, it'll just give it a little incentive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we locate the creature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With these. He picks up a small portable unit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking device.  You set it to search for a moving object... It hasn't got much range, but when you get within a certain distance, it starts beeping. Standard takes the device and studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These will be very useful.  At least we won't have to go digging around in closets with our bare hands.  All right, here's the battle plan: we're going to break into two teams and start systematically covering the ship.  Whoever finds it first, catches it in the net and ejects it from the nearest airlock.  Clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even simple. Standard shoots him a vicious look, then continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For starters, let's make sure the bridge is safe. Faust takes the device and turns it on.  He scans it arou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- Roby and Melkonis will go with Faust.  Hunter and I will make up the second team. They start doling out the equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll all carry communicators.  We want to keep in constant touch.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Melkonis and Roby carry the net, while Faust walks direct carrying the tracking device.  He continually scans it fr side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing yet... nothing... we can move pretty fast as long as there's nothing on the tracker.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Hunter move silently along.  Standard is for double function, carrying one edge of the net and the tra

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby's team is moving at a fairly brisk pace, when:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. Faust's tracker is BEEPING, and a small light flashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got something. Immediately, they grow very tense and start looking aroun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peers closely at tracker and frowns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Machine's screwed up, I can't tell. Needle's spinning all over the dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it malfunctioning? Faust turns the tracker on its side, and the needle stabi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just confused.  It's coming from below us. They all look down at their feet.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby, Melkonis, and Faust come carefully down a set of cr stairs, into a drab, functional section of the ship. The corridors in this level are lit by rows of bare bulbs ceiling.  The effect is ugly and confining. They stop at the foot of the stairs and move into positio the net across the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at tracker and nodding down the passageway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way. They begin to walk down the passageway, footsteps clangin metal flooring.  It is extremely dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the lights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bulbs burned out, nobody bothered to replace 'em. They switch on the helmet lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it. They all stop quickly, almost stumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's within 4 meters. Roby and Melkonis heft the net, each keeping his prod in prod in one hand and tracker in the other, has the unplea approaching the source of the signal. He moves with great care, in a half crouch, ready to leap second, prod extended, constantly glancing at the tracker The tracking device leads him right up to a small hatch o wall. Behind his plastic mask, sweat is pouring down Faust's fa down the tracker and reaches for the little door.  He rai grasps the door handle, yanks it open, and jams the elect inside.

dialogues.speaker: THE CABINET, EYES GLARING, CLAWS FLASHING.
dialogues.text: Instinctively, they throw the net over it, but:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hold it! They open the net and release the creature.  IT IS THE CA spitting, it scampers away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're making fools of ourselves! Roby's COMMUNICATOR BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into communicator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got it up here!  It's trapped! Get up here fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food-storage room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming! They dash for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby, Faust, and Melkonis charge down the hallways until at:

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard and Hunter are waiting for them, in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw it inside and slammed the door on it!  It's in there now! On the other side of the door, CRASHING AND BANGING can b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it doing, having a seizure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started crashing around right after we locked it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we open the door and net it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to open that door. Again the thing can be heard CRASHING AROUND INSIDE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks completely different from the first one -- it's more like a worm with legs... and tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we better do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we don't have to.  It's trapped in there.  We could just leave it in there all the way back to Irth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what we can do.  We can pump poison gas into the room and kill it.  Through those ventilator slots there. He indicates a row of slots in the bottom of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait a minute!  That's all our food supplies in there!  We can't pump poison gas all over them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we kill the thing we won't need the food any more -- we can go straight into hypersleep.  Also, it sounds like that thing is already doing a pretty good job on our supplies; it may be fouling them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You win.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody gimme a hand, I'll get the stuff.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL THAT they are fastening a lar shaped device over the ventilator grill at the bottom of This funnel is attached to a thick hose, which runs back metal tank with pressure gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those masks on. They pull on gas masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This stuff's deadly -- I hope we know what we're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Jay. Faust turns on the machine.  It begins to throb as it pum through the hose and into the room. Immediately, THE CRASHING NOISES RISE IN CRESCENDO, AND T BE HEARD SCREECHING AND SQUEALING. Then the sounds stop altogether.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it off. Faust shuts off the pump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?  Now we go in. Standard steps to the door and opens it.  A thick cloud o out.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The room is thick with the poison gas.  The men look like their gasmasks. The food packages are ripped to shreds, and foodstuffs ar all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like he helped himself. Carefully, the men poke through the garbage, net and prod Then Hunter points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it. They all look where he is pointing.  In the wall, A VENTI HAS BEEN RIPPED OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It escaped. They move to the shredded ventilator and shine their ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where does that go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All over the ship; we'll have to check the charts to know for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go and do it. They head for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have we got any food at all left in the ship? They slam the door shut and seal it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The screens are showing them a schematic of the ship's sy ventilator shafts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one section of the ventilator shaft has only two outlets -- you notice?  The food storage room on one end --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And the cooling unit on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's trapped in between -- now we have to drive it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't pump poison gas down into the cooling unit!  It'll flood the whole ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only other thing I can think of is for somebody to crawl in there and flush it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man would need protection, obviously -- as well as some way to drive the thing before him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a flamethrower?  That wouldn't poison the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So one of us goes into the airshaft and drives the thing along --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While the rest of us wait down in the cooling unit with the net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a rough one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a better idea? Hunter shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the only question left is: who gets to crawl down the airshaft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be democratic. He tears five small sheets of paper from a pad on his con of them, he draws a large X.  Then he wads each piece of tiny little ball. He rolls the paperballs between his hands and tosses them like dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martin, take one. Roby picks one up and unfolds it.  It is blank. Melkonis picks up another and opens it.  Again blank. Faust picks up a ball, and Standard immediately picks his are both blank. They all look at Hunter, who has not yet unfolded his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it up, Cleave.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hunter is strapping on an oxygen mask and a flame thrower helping him. Finally, Faust hands him a tracking device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, uh... good luck.  I hope you won't need me, but if you do, I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grimly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Hunter turns and climbs into the ventilator opening, whic large enough to crawl through.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: It is completely dark in the shaft.  Hunter reaches up an helmet light.  Then he switches on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you guys read me down there?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Melkonis and Roby are spreading out the net.  W of huge cooling plants, and their hair ruffles.  Large ai off in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're getting into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm starting now. He begins to crawl forward into the narrow metal tunnel. corner. After a couple more tight turns, THE TRACKER SUDDENLY BEE Hunter twitches.  He raises his flamethrower and FIRES A DARKNESS.  It roars loudly in the confined tube, and the heats up.  Smoke drifts back into his face.  He begins to

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby points to a large rectangular opening in one wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  That's where it's got to come out. He throws a switch, and a large metal panel rises and sea opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a flip-flop gate to channel the air, but we can use it to trap the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now let's keep it closed. Melkonis is setting up a little portable unit with a scre screen shows a section of the ship's schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Hunter... and something else as well, in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they close?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're on the next level up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get moving with this net. They lift the net up, holding it in front of the opening.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hunter is still crawling on hands and knees.  Up ahead, h the shaft takes an abrupt downward turn. He crawls toward the down angle, then fires another blast flamethrower. Then he starts crawling down, head first. When he is nearly upside-down, the shaft takes yet anothe which puts him into a nearly impossible position, almost Then the tracker starts BEEPING LIKE CRAZY. Frantically, he fumbles the flamethrower around, but the narrow -- it is difficult maneuvering.  He hears a HISSIN ahead, and claws scrambling on metal. Then he has the weapon into position, and sprays another flaming burst toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Melkonis is staring at his screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting pretty close now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then -- when it gets to the other side of the door, you sing out, then drop the door.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Roby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you and I will bag it, and then we'll take it to the ventral air lock, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tensely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Hunter is huddled against a wall of the shaft, clutching flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into communicator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this shaft goes on too much farther... anyway it's getting pretty hot in here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into communicator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, our screens show you as being near to the opening.  We'll open it up, then we'll cue you and you can start blasting.  That'll drive it right out.  You don't have to go any farther.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He readies the flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get ready. He and Roby heft their respective ends of the net, crouch the small creature when it darts out.  Melkonis picks up prod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the vent, Sandy. Melkonis reaches over and throws the switch.  The metal g down, opening up the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: OVER-SIZED BIRD AND GRABS MELKONIS IN RAZOR-SHARP TENTACL
dialogues.text: Melkonis lets out a horrible shriek, and the thing grabs one claw and TWISTS IT OFF LIKE A MAN PULLING THE HEAD OF THEN THROWS IT TO THE FLOOR WITH AN AUDIBLE CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE MONSTER LEAPS HEAD-FIRST INTO ANOTHER AIR SHAFT.
dialogues.text: Standard and Roby are left standing in shock.  After a mo climbs out of the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  Where is it? They break from their paralysis, and run toward the openi creature just leaped into.  It is another shaft, going do darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it get so big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By eating our food supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Melkonis?

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust is still waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his communicator)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, are you guys still there? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet us on the bridge.  Be careful -- it's huge now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Faust lets himself out of the food storage room and caref the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Roby and Hunter are rapidly ascending toward th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean his body was still kicking when it ran off with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was horrible -- horrible.  Like a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Roby and Hunter enter and drop into chairs.  Fa shortly.  They all look blank, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  Where's Sandy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's monstrous -- it grew, like some horrible tapeworm.  We were completely unprepared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's still in the ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd better seal off the lower maintenance level; at least trap it there. (throws a switch; circuitry lights up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least it can't get up here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down, four to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angrily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, it sure didn't like this flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- we can't kill it on the ship, but we can at least keep it at bay -- and maybe drive it into the air lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing is, I'm about out of fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some more combustible fuel down in the storage lockers next to the lounge. (rises)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't want us separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just sealed it off; it can't get to that section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't count on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure need this flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right... but do not go below decks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. (heads for the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be right back. Faust exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time we took a hard look at those heiroglyphs. Roby begins to punch buttons; the photographs of the heir appear on some of the screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you make out any pattern in all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (baffled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... yes... there's a pattern... but it's meaningless to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it looks like a senseless jumble, but if you look closely, there are recognizable forms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognizable!  In that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In symbolic form... very stylized...  but if you stare at it, you can see some of the different creatures we've been dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I suppose that star-shaped thing could be the parasite that got on Broussard.  Is that what you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And right next to it, that oval design with the markings -- it's a dead ringer for the spore casings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That next thing there -- six legs, tentacles -- that's the thing we saw in the food locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the next step should be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The big one.  And there it is. Out of meaningless geometric symbols on a wall, it has be to recognize each stage in the alien's life cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all the same creature.  We're seeing the different stages in its life-cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that tomb... must have been some kind of fertility temple... where they stored their eggs, and maybe held mating rituals...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... And Broussard got caught in their reproductive cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will notice, though, that there are no more phases.  Only four forms are shown.  After that the pattern repeats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which presumably means...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... More spores coming.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust quickly turns a couple of corners and then comes to halt when he notices that a DOOR LEADING TO THE LOWER DEC WRENCHED OFF ITS HINGES. He hesitates, uncertain what to do, then there is A SOUND

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTION OF THE AIR LOCK... AND THE INNER LOCK DOOR IS O
dialogues.text: Faust hesitates and peers into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature is squatting in the middle of the floor, gna bloody thigh bone.  It does not see Faust.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Stealthfully, dropping back into the shadows, Faust press intercom and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the lock -- blow the main lock.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard, Roby and Hunter are staring at the pictures.  T Faust catches Standard in mid-sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the main air lock.  Blow the lock.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard hesitates, starts to frame a reply -- then chang and runs to his console -- and THROWS THE SWITCH.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: With a mechanical whine, the inner door starts to close. hears it and INSTANTANEOUSLY LEAPS OUT OF THE LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature comes flying out of the lock and DEALS FAUST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: crushing him to a thickness of about three inches. On the wall, a green light goes on:

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Despite the fact that the inner door is still held open a by Faust's squashed body, THE OUTER DOOR BEGINS TO SLIDE

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: In dead silence, a thick spurt of steam comes out of the door.  This is the ship's atmosphere freezing as it squir the vacuum under pressure.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: INSTANTLY, A TREMENDOUS WINDSTORM STARTS UP as the ship's sucked out toward the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment of panic and confusion, Roby bolts out of room.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Loose papers and articles of furniture hurtle through the as Roby hurries toward the rock, partly running, partly s by the air current.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: A huge plume of steam grows from the side of the ship, wi of tiny loose particles tumbling out in it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Whipped by the hurricane wind, Roby crashes to a momentar against a wall.  As he hesitates there, trying to regain

dialogues.speaker: HE SEES THE CREATURE SCURRYING AWAY DOWN ANOTHER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Ignoring the monster, he pushes off from the wall and sta again.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby stops himself by grabbing the edge of a doorway at t hall down from the airlock.  Here, the wind is really ter clothes flap on his body and all kinds of things fly by - is a DEAFENING WHISTLE. Instantly, Roby starts turning a large wheel, which begin sliding hatch door, closing off the air lock corridor.  A closes, THE CURRENT DECREASES, THEN IS FINALLY CUT OFF AS Done in, he collapses to the floor. Then he clutches his throat and begins to gasp for breath the thinness of the air, THE SOUND LEVEL IN THE SHIP IS V THIN, DISTANT, ALMOST INAUDIBLE.  Roby is gasping loudly, barely hear him; and his footsteps boom thinly like a man underwater.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Clutching his throat, he comes across the others -- Stand Hunter -- and they are all choking, clawing at their thro like fishes out of water.  They are sweating heavily and bleed. They try to speak to each other, but the sound is so muff only hear distant croaks. Standard mumbles something and stumbles down the hall.  T follow him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The door bursts open and Standard reels in, his footsteps thinly on the metal flooring.  We see several rows of lar tanks, all connected by hoses to a few petcocks. Standard staggers to these and starts twisting the handle them.  THERE IS A PIERCING HISS OF ESCAPING AIR, AND THE GRADUALLY RETURNS TO NORMAL as Standard and the others si floor, gasping in the oxygen gratefully. Finally they have recovered enough to be able to sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much oxygen did we lose? Standard rises unsteadily and peers at the gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got six hours left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anybody know what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it.  Faust got himself jammed in the air lock door.  His body held it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I had to seal off a whole section.  We'd lose too much of our remaining air if we opened the connecting door.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Faust's body, crushed in the inner door, floats weightles vacuum.  His nose and mouth are crusted with huge gobs of

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three survivors -- Standard, Roby and Hunter -- slump The cat emerges from a hiding place, yowling with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the cat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor kitty; puss puss puss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we're rid of the damn monster.  It must have been the first thing sucked out of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No such luck.  I saw it running down one of the corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groans)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no!  We can't fight this thing! There's only six hours of air left -- we're dead men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't buy that.  There's still time to destroy it and get ourselves in the freezers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time for drastic remedies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was time for that a couple days ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind of remark is pointless. Now come on -- I want to hear every suggestion you can come up with, no matter how wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't kill it on board.  It's huge now and must have tremendous amounts of that acid in its body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got an idea, but you're not going to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  First we shut down all the cooling systems on the stardrive engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll blow the ship up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... but it'll take a few minutes for the engines to overheat and melt down the core.  In the meantime, we get in the lifeboat and leave the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow the ship up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the creature with it.  We can make it back to Irth in the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the lifeboat can't accelerate to light speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter -- we're already at light speed.  And when we get back to the Colonies, they'll pick us up in the network.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about all the minerals and elements in the cargo hold?  That's the only reason we came out here. We'd have to abandon them all.  We'd be broke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our lives are more important. Anyway, we can take a small amount of the most valuable stuff with us on the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it won't work and I just realized why.  There's only one hypersleep freezer on the lifeboat. Only one of us could survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the idea's good, if we could just turn it around somehow. They think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we could just get the creature into the lifeboat, we could launch it into space and blow it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good!  That's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can load the lifeboat up with explosives and trigger them remotely, once the lifeboat is in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's going to be almost impossible to drive it up into the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can use the flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not going to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't say that; I think it's a good plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flamethrower needs more fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  We've got a lot to accomplish.  Let's get moving. INTERIOR - MINING & CARGO BAY The three men come down steps into this rather dirty area A lot of tools and large items of machinery are stored ar

dialogues.speaker: LONG RACKS OF SHELVES ARE STOCKED WITH METAL CONTAINERS O
dialogues.text: SHAPES.  Each container is well packed and labelled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which explosive should we use?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd suggest the N-13 sticks.  They're portable, and they can be radio detonated. Hunter begins to unlock a locker and draw out long, red s broomhandles, with tiny printing on them. Meanwhile, ROBY IS STARING AT THE ROWS OF METAL CANNISTER one of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it's funny -- this stuff we went to so much trouble to dig up -- this treasure, the paydirt -- it'll make it back to Irth just fine -- even if we're not with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, carry these. Hunter takes an armload of the red broomsticks, and stumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey watch it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stable; it doesn't hurt to drop it. They begin to carry the explosives up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The three men are carrying their equipment along the hall Hunter's tracker suddenly BEEPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it! They all stop.  The tracker BEEPS AGAIN.  Hunter puts dow points the tracker around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding up some steps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up there. They all look at each other.  Standard puts down his bund up the flamethrower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do?  Do we ignore it and finish loading the explosives into the boat -- or do we flush it out now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.  If we can get it into the boat, we won't have to blow it up -- we can just eject it into space. Standard hefts the flamethrower and starts up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard's face is tense as he advances up the circular s Suddenly, a METALLIC TAPPING SOUND is heard.  He freezes. Then he continues up.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The view of interstellar space is spectacular.  As Standa the steps, the METALLIC TAPPING is heard again. Standard looks around.  Then he sees it -- BROUSSARD'S CO OUTSIDE THE GLASS OF THE DOME.  It is tangled in some rig movement of the machinery causes the cadaver to tap on th periodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can come up!  It's safe! The others come up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spying the corpse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- Jesus -- Broussard's corpse is blue and bloated where the wrapping loose.  Bumping against the glass, he looks like he wants

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship's gravitational attraction must have drawn him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go outside and bring him in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... the risk is too great.  Perhaps after we've destroyed the thing. Glancing back, the men retreat from the observation dome. remains against the glass, peering in with dead eyes.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The floor slopes upward slightly here as the corridor fun ends in the entrance to a narrow passageway or crawl-way. passageway connects the nose of the ship with the lifeboa The three men come up to the entrance to the passageway, equipment.  They duck in and walk the short distance to t

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The passageway connects into the rear of the lifeboat.  I extremely simple, stripped-down vehicle; even the metal s beams-are exposed.  A single hypersleep freezer takes up of floor space.  It is an escape-craft, nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the base of the walls there. They begin to stack the red broomsticks against the base on both sides of the lifeboat, and to wire them into posi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should hope so!  And we'd better make sure it's pretty far from the ship when we blow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surveys the craft uneasily)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we really need is some red meat in here for bait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if we had some, I'd eat it. I'm starting to get hungry. By this time, they are exiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... now we have to herd that thing up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever's doing the herding is gonna have their hands pretty full.  I think somebody should stay by the lifeboat to slam the door on the thing once it's inside, and to serve as... as...  (searches for a word)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't "bait" the word you used?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, somebody has to have his hands free to lock the creature in the lifeboat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and maybe launch the boat and blow it too... if the others are injured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gets the privilege? INSERT: THREE CRUMPLED PIECES OF PAPER.  Three hands pick ANGLE ON ROBY.  He unfolds his paper, turns it so the oth it.  It has a big X on it. ANOTHER ANGLE - SHORTLY LATER.  Hunter is showing Roby a like a transistor radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your finger off the button till she's way away from the ship, that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it armed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you press the button right now, it will blow the whole nose of the ship off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the thought. (puts detonator in his breast pocket)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Martin, we'll be in touch with you on the communicator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll let me know when you've got it coming this way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you stand aside while we drive it in, then shut the hatch, launch the boat, and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kablooey. Hunter's face twitches nervously at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on; we haven't much time, air is a factor. They leave the nose of the ship, Standard carrying the fl Hunter the tracker. Roby settles himself at the controls, runs through them b familiarize himself.  Using a switch, he opens and closes door a couple of times.  It slams open and shut quite rap He presses a few buttons and sets the launch button to "R Then STANDARD'S VOICE comes from the communicator:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got something on the tracker... got to be it, it's too big for the cat. This is a VERY SPOOKY SCENE, ROBY ALONE BY THE LIFEBOAT, THE VOICES ON THE COMMUNICATOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over, filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from down there. Roby hears various tinny sound effects, rustlings, clunki breathing, etc.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Standard has the flamethrower at the ready, and Hunter is the tracker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must have stopped moving.  I'm not getting anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go first; you stay behind me. Carefully, Standard advances down the corridor.  Then THE OUT OF HIDING BEHIND HUNTER, AND PICKS HIM UP. HUNTER SCREAMS. Standard whirls around, sees the thing clutching Hunter. off to one side, as though to keep Standard from getting Standard doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flamethrower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, the acid will pour out! At that moment the creature TAKES A BITE OUT OF HUNTER, W MORTAL AGONY. Standard can take it no longer; he raises the flamethrowe

dialogues.speaker: CATCHES THE FULL BLAST OF THE FLAME.
dialogues.text: Standard instantly stops firing, but now Hunter is a kick flame, held out at arm's length by the monster.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is listening to all this on the communicator.  He ca shrieks and crashing noises. Then the communicator goes dead, and all he hears is a ru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Standard?  Hunter? He waits quite a while for a response, but we can see fro expression that he expects none. He drops his face into his hands.  When he lifts his head managed to summon a certain amount of resolve.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby walks along watching the tracker, carrying a pistol hand.  He comes across Standard's flamethrower, lying on picks it up, substituting it for the pistol. Then he continues to follow the tracker; it takes him dow into the maintenance level.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby follows the device for a short distance until it ind the source of the signal is directly under his feet.  Loo sees that he is standing on a square metal plate. Getting down on his hands and knees, he removes the heavy revealing a black opening with a ladder going down. Substituting the tracker for a flashlight, but still carr flamethrower, Roby starts down the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Shining the light around into the darkness, Roby descends ladder to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: PIECES OF CLOTHING, AND SHOES.
dialogues.text: Something moves in the darkness -- Roby turns his light o HANGING FROM THE CEILING IS A HUGE COCOON.  It appears to some fine, white, silk-like material, and it is slowly un Flamethrower ready, Roby approaches the cocoon.  As he ge enough, he sees that the cocoon is semi-transparent and T STANDARD IS INSIDE IT. Unexpectedly, Standard's eyes open, and focus on Roby -- violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a feeble whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sickened)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did it do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moves his head slightly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look...  Roby turns his light where Standard indicates.  Another c from the ceiling, but this one looks a little different. and darker, with a harder shell.  In fact, it looks almos THE SPORES IN THE TOMB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Melkonis... it ate Hunter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around for a tool)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get you out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can save you -- get you to the Autodoc!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No good... it's eaten too much of me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in horror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill me...  Roby stares at him in horror, then bends down and takes a at him.  REACTING, he straightens back up, raises the fla sprays a molten blast.  When the entire room is in flames scrambles back up the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby drops to his knees and gasps for breath, trying not At length, he regains control of himself.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK appears to hang motionless, with planets and st rolling past in the infinite distance.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is putting the cat into a metal, vacuum-sealed catbo little oxygen tank on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitty go bye-bye. He seals the catbox, then turns on the oxygen.  There is of pressurized air.  Wild-eyed, the cat peers out of a li front.  It YOWLS. He picks up the pressurized catbox and leaves the bridge. INTERIOR - MINING & CARGO BAY Carrying the catbox and a shoulder bag (and of course the flamethrower), Roby goes quickly to the nearest rank of m cannisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from labels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be, Kitty?  Here -- how about some Tacitum-35, ten kilos of it.  This'll buy us an island on some nice planet. Putting the invaluable cannister into the shoulder bag, h back up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Catbox in one hand, flamethrower in the other, Roby enter room, containing the massive stardrive engines. He puts down his parcels and approaches the main control engines.  Studying the instructions, he begins to close s by one. A SIREN BEGINS TO HONK THROUGHOUT THE SHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  The cooling units for the stardrive engines are not functioning!  Engines will overload in 4 minutes, 50 seconds!  Attention! Finally Roby closes the last switch.  Shaking with nervou hurriedly picks up catbox, bag and flamethrower and hurri engine room.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby hurries on, listening to the siren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will overheat and main core will melt in 4 minutes, 30 seconds!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby comes hustling up to where the lifeboat is berthed. he starts to enter the connecting passageway.

dialogues.speaker: LIFEBOAT.
dialogues.text: It HISSES and starts toward him.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby leaps out of the passageway, bounds to the controls, the switch.  The hatch door SLAMS SHUT, locking the thing lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will overload in 4 minutes! Indecisive, Roby stares at the lifeboat "LAUNCH" button. be heard fumbling around in the passageway. Finally, he turns and bolts back toward the engine room.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Like a maniac, Roby runs through the ship, level after le down stairwells, his footsteps clanging metallically thro ship as he sprints for the engine room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will overload in 3 minutes, 30 seconds!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The door crashes open and Roby comes running in.  The roo smoke and the engines are whining dangerously.  It is ext the room; Roby instantly breaks out in sweat. He runs to controls and begins throwing back on the cooli switches. Still THE SIREN CONTINUES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will overload in 3 minutes! Roby pushes a button and speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer!  I've turned all the cooling units back on!  What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reaction has proceeded too far. The core has begun to melt.  Engines will overload in 2 minutes, 35 seconds. A look of terror comes onto Roby's face.  He turns and ru engine room.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Again, Roby must run through all the levels of the ship, up the stairs, exhausted, stumbling, while the computer c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will overload in 2 minutes!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Reeling, gasping for breath, Roby staggers into the vesti the lifeboat is berthed.  He grabs the flamethrower and t the passageway. It is then he realizes that THE LIFEBOAT DOOR IS OPEN AGA Quickly, he glances around to see if the creature might b Then he advances on the passageway.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Dripping with sweat, his face a mask of fear, Roby enters passageway, flamethrower gripped tightly in his hands.  H by the siren and the computer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will explode in 90 seconds! He makes it all the way to the end of the passageway, the head into the lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: HIS POINT-OF-VIEW as he quickly scans the lifeboat, revea EMPTY.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Immediately, he turns and dashes back to the head of the There he grabs the catbox and bag, then runs back into th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention!  Engines will explode in 60 seconds!

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: He comes in on the run, hurls the catbox and bag toward t does a dive over the back of the control chair.  He is no seat than he hits the "LAUNCH" button.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The retainer clips drop away, and with a blast of ramjets

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is frantically strapping himself in, as the lifeboat away from the mother ship.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The tiny pod of the lifeboat accelerates away from the la the SNARK.  The scene is strangely serene for such deadly circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby finishes strapping himself in, then he reaches and g catbox.  The cat is YOWLING.  Roby hugs the box to his ch his head down over it.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The SNARK drifts ever farther away as the lifeboat leaves until it is barely a point of light. THEN IT BLOWS UP.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The shockwave hits the escape craft, jolting it and rattl everything inside.  Then all is quiet. Roby unhooks himself from his straps, rises, and goes to the lifeboat.  He stares out through the porthole.  His f in orange light.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: What he sees is the boiling fireball, now fading and fizz into nothingness, and a couple of pieces of debris floati

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby's expression is mournful as he watches the final obl his ship and friends.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LIFEBOAT ALL ALONG.
dialogues.text: The cat SCREECHES. Roby whirls, and finds himself facing the thing across th the boat.  It squats, then pulls out its trophy -- a man' It begins to eat the arm, watching Roby. His first thought is for the flamethrower -- unfortunatel the floor right next to the monster.  Next he glances aro place to hide.  His eye falls on a tiny locker containing with the door standing open. He begins to edge toward the locker.  The creature rises. It throws down the arm.  With that, Roby dives for the op door, hurls himself inside, and slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: There is a clear glass panel in the door, and the thing p right up to the glass, peering in at Roby.  The locker is Roby's face is only inches away from the creature's.  The disgusting.  It turns its head, looking at him in curiosi Then the MOANING OF THE CAT distracts it.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature waddles over to where the pressurized catbox bends down and peers inside.  The CAT YOWLS LOUDER. It picks up the catbox in its tentacles.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Trying to distract the monster away from the cat, Roby TA GLASS. But the monster reacts so fast that its face is instantly glass, startling the hell out of Roby. Getting no more interference from him, the thing returns catbox. Roby looks around.  He spies the spacesuit.  Quickly, he it on.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature picks the catbox up in its tentacles and sha if there is anything inside.  The cat MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is halfway into the pressure suit.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature throws the catbox down.  It clangs, and boun picks it up again and hammers it against the wall.  Then into a crevice in the wall. With one tentacle, it begins to pound the sealed catbox i crevice.  The cat has gone beyond hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby pulls on the helmet, latches it into place, then tur oxygen.  With a hiss, the suit fills itself. In a rack on the wall is a long metal rod with a blunt ru Roby peels the rubber off, revealing a sharp steel point. Again he raps on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature turns.  It faces the locker, peers at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try a little of this, you fucking bastard. HE KICKS THE DOOR OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature rises, but just in time to catch THE STEEL S THROUGH ITS MIDRIFF. IT MAKES A HORRIBLE NOISE AND CLUTCHES AT THE SPUR.  The begins to flow from the wound. Before the acid can touch the floor, Roby reaches back an switch -- BLOWING THE REAR HATCH. In a poof, the tiny atmosphere in the lifeboat is sucked space -- and the bleeding creature along with it.  Roby g strut to keep from being sucked out, but as the creature WRAPS THE END OF A TENTACLE AROUND HIS ANKLE.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby is now hanging halfway out of the lifeboat, with the clinging to his leg.  He kicks at it with his free foot, let go.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Looking for any salvation, Roby grabs the hatch control l yanks it. The hatch slams shut, closing Roby safely inside but TRAP OF THE CREATURE'S TENTACLE IN THE DOORJAMB. It instantly releases Roby, who staggers back.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The creature is now outside the lifeboat, in the vacuum, the tip of its tentacle caught in the closed hatch.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Where the tentacle is caught in the hatch, it is wounded, starting to foam with acid, eating away at the metal. Roby stumbles forward to the controls and pushes a lever

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The jet exhausts are located at the rear of the craft, ri creature is wriggling.  THE ENGINES BELCH FLAME FOR A FEW SHUT OFF. INCINERATED, THE CREATURE TUMBLES SLOWLY AWAY INTO SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: Roby hurries to the rear hatch and looks out after the th

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The burned mass of the monster drifts slowly away into sp writhing, smoking, foaming mass. As it tumbles into the distance, pieces drop off it -- it then bursts, soggily, sending a spray of particles off in directions.  The last we see of it is a few smouldering r into infinity.

dialogues.speaker: INTERIOR
dialogues.text: The boat is re-pressurized and Roby is seated in the cont seems calm and composed, almost cheerful.  The cat purrs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dictating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So it looks like I'll make it back to the Colonies on schedule after all.  I should be to the frontier in another 250 years or so, and then with a little luck the network will pick me up.  I'm not as rich as I was a couple days ago -- but I'm not exactly broke either. Incidentally, I did manage to salvage one souvenir out of this whole mess. He reaches down into the carrying bag he brought on board out the ALIEN SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor Yorick here should go at least partway toward proving I'm not a crank.  I wish it was him we'd met in the first place -- things might have turned out different. He puts the skull down on a shelf and locks a glass lid o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Martin Roby, executive officer, last survivor of the commercial vessel SNARK, signing off. Come on, cat, let's go to sleep. Roby leans forward and switches off the recorder.  Then h carrying the cat, walks to the hypersleep freezer, which He climbs in and stretches out on his back, holding the c his chest.  With one hand, he presses a switch, and THE L HIM. CLOSE-UP OF THE ALIEN SKULL, watching sentinel over the s Roby like some dead, melancholy pixie.

dialogues.speaker: EXTERIOR
dialogues.text: The lifeboat -- SNARK 2 -- sails away toward its rendezvo 250 years from now. As SNARK 2 drifts past camera, we suddenly see that A SPO ADHERED TO THE UNDERBELLY OF THE CRAFT. ROLL END TITLES & MUSIC.
